blackjack

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackjack.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a player of blackjack, that has Player has two lists: the list of Hands and the list of bets. The hands and bets are related in a way that if a hand and a bet are in the same indexes in the corresponding Lists than the bet value is the bet associated to that hand. numHands corresponds to the number of hands that player has at some instant. currentHand gives the index of the current hand in play in the list hands. insuranceBet is the value bet in insurance. oldbet is the first bet from the previous hand played.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pedro Esteves, Ricardo Cristino, Rui Br√°s

      • setInsuranceBet

        protected boolean setInsuranceBet()
        When player hits insurance, it's set insuranceBet to the current bet value, than it's verified if balance is enough to do this play before updating balance.
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • deal

        public boolean deal()
        This function verifies if the player already made the bet (if typed b command). Returns false if that condition wasn't verified and true if it was verified. When it returns true, it also sets the oldbet to the value of the new bet.
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • doubleDown

        protected void doubleDown(Card c)
        This function gets the value of the actual bet of associated to the current hand in play, than debits it in players balance, doubles the value of the bet and adds a card to the hand in play from the list of hands.
        Parameters:
        c - the c

      • reBet

        protected boolean reBet(double b,
                        double min_bet)
        This function is used when it's typed the command b is retyped. If the player retypes bet command, the previous bet is re-added to the to player's balance. If the player typed only "b", if it wasn't any hand played before it bets a value corresponding to the minimum bet, if it were played other hands before, than it bets the value played in the previous hand. If the played typed "b value" than it bets the specified value In the end the new value of the bet is discounted in the player's balance and the bet value is updated If this function returns false it's because the player didn't have enough credits to conclude the action.
        Parameters:
        b - the b
        min_bet - the min_bet
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • bet

        protected boolean bet(double b,
                      double min_bet)
        This function checks the b command and sets a value to the bet. If the player types "b" the bet value is set to the value of the bet from the previous hand played, if there was no previous hand the value is set to the minimum bet. If it was typed "b value" it bets value. All this operations are only allowed if the player have a balance greater or equal than the bet value. In the end balance and bet values are updated. If this function returns false it's because the player didn't have enough credits to perform the action.
        Parameters:
        b - the b
        min_bet - the min_bet
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • split

        protected void split(Card a,
                     Card b)
        This function receives two arguments from type Card. When the function is called, a new empty Hand is created and added to the list hands, in the index after the position of the splitting hand. A new bet is also added in bet list, in the same index as the new Hand, and it's set to the value of the bet of the splitting hand. The card in index 1 from the splitting hand is added to the new hand, card a is added to the splitted hand, and card b is added to the new hand. If the splitting hand is a pair of aces, the hand state handCanBeHit is set to false in both new hands to prevent any further hit or double. The only allowed actions after the split of two aces is standing of splitting if there is another pair of aces.
        Parameters:
        a - the a
        b - the b

      • allHandsBusted

        public boolean allHandsBusted()
        This function returns true if all hands have busted or false if not all hands have busted. Values of the elements of the list bet are set to zero in game class when a hand busts.
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • printPlayingHand

        public void printPlayingHand()
        When it was splits, it's typed in the terminal the hand that is currently in play.

      • printStart

        public void printStart(java.lang.String action)
        Makes the first prints after commands s, h, 2 and p. Function receives a string corresponding the action made ("2", "h", "2" or "p").
        Parameters:
        action - the action

      • printBustedHand

        public void printBustedHand()
        Prints that player busts if there is only one hand ore the hand that have busted if there were more than one hand.
